text: The Thrillist is the greatest vegan thing EVER! So many great and tasty vegan options! Drove all the way from LA for their food! Really cool people!

I love catching these guys whenever they're out and about, whether in a parking lot somewhere or the local farmer's market. Great vegan food that is fresh and creative and extremely delicious! Their beer-battered avocado and BBQ pulled jack fruit tacos are so good! But the fave is definitely the philly cheeze steak sandwhich made out of seitan. Meat gobblers wouldn't be able to tell the difference! Overall, what matters most about these wonderful people, is that they not only serve up gorgeously good food,but they are all plant-based, Non-GMO, use locally whenever possible and omit all refined ingredients. Who said that you cannot eat really well and be healthy?

Love this taco stand! Especially the jackfruit tacos. Great flavor! The beer battered avocado tacos are also a special treat. You get two smallish tacos in an order. The price point is for quality, specialty foods - it is at a farmers market after all. Depending on the day, they also have pozole soup (yummy), raw desserts, Philly cheese steaks, and a few other items. All vegan and all simple fresh ingredients grilled right in front of you. You should definitely try them out.

This place is one of my favorite places to go in the valley. The Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is what i dream about. Their tacos are amazing and they seem to regularly change up their menu, which is nice. I cannot leave their tent without grabbing some of their fresh made Jaimica. 

It is one of those rare vegan places where you are staring at the menu for 15 minutes because you just can't choose. Family run and very friendly. I haven't tried their vegan cheesecakes, but they seem like a crowd favorite. I would 10/10 recommend the Garden Grill to any vegan, or meat eater, that enjoys food!

Four stars due to a website that is not kept updated. There have been multiple times where i have traveled across the valley to find this "food truck" in their regular spots, but they are not there. After i find this out and check their website, there is nothing there saying that they cancelled that day. Apparently they keep their Instagram updated very well; however, for those of us who don't use Instagram, it would be nice to see that the website is updated. 

Great place!

philly cheezesteaks!  

omg! sooooooooooooo delicious.  $10 (a bit pricy in my opinion but still...)  yum yum yum yum

I am not even vegan, but I think this guys do a PHENOMENAL job, the tacos I have tried there are simply DELICIOUS, especially the battered avocado one, YUM!!! And on top of it, the staff (which seams to be one family?!) are super nice!! Well done guys, and we will come back!!
This place has the best vegan food in Las Vegas.  They have tasty tacos and sandwiches.   The people are very friendly - I highly recommend it.

Best of Las Vegas 2014,2015 Best of The City 2015 
Once you try any of Chef Leslie's delicious creations
you will be back for more and you won't mind standing 
in line. Assada Jack Tacos, Crispy Chicken Sandwich,
California Burrito and Chocolate Cheesecake (the best
on the planet) Truly the BEST!

This place is Soooooooooooo good.  The Buffalo Chick'n sandwich is mind boggling.  Taco are fantastic. Only complaint is they are only open one Wednesday and Saturday. I am going to buy them a restaurant so I can eat there everyday....

Amazing people make amazing plant based comforting food. Please check their website to find days/locations. Help them get the "seed" money for a permanent home. Las Vegas needs them. We all need them to be open everyday.
I absolutely love garden grill! Fresh vegan ingredients. "Chicken" sandwich will rock you and the avo tacos.....ADDICTED! small family owned, honest, great people, delicious & healthy food!!

I have eaten here two days in a row now. I've shared a Jack Fruit "Pulled Pork" Taco, a Beer-Battered Avocado Taco, a Chick'n Sandwich,  a Breakfast Burrito, and a Breakfast Sandwich. Each dish was nothing short of amazing. I'd be remiss to attempt to pick a favorite. Everything had amazing flavor and texture. I typically do not like fake meat products, but this food tastes delicious! They are worth trying whether you have a vegan diet, or not.

One of my favorite spots to go eat with some delicious vegan selections. I go at least once or twice a week usually get a "chicken" sandwich lettuced wrapped which is my favorite, some tacos, or the specials they have going for the day. Actually not going to lie I've pretty much have tried everything they've had or have to offer on the menu and have never been let down. They have such great vegan and organic plant based options with great spices and flavors. Also to mention the great staff. They always have awesome service every time I go, such nice people to chat with when I come, and also very professional.

This is good as it gets! I have tried everything Garden Grill has on their menu.i couldn't even tell you a favorite because everything is amazing. I am talking about food so good it hits your emotions.  The breakfast tacos, the beer battered avocado tacos, and the jackfruit tacos warm my heart and I find some days incomplete without having my Garden Grill fix. The cheesecake with strawberry sauce is by far the best cheesecake I have ever eaten. Thank you for all of the awesome food that's delicious and actually good for me. I can't wait for my Wednesday fix :)

Let me start by saying, if I could give this place 20 stars, I would.  I bartended a special event downtown, and they were a vendor there.  I'm a vegetarian so this was really the only place that had anything I could eat.  It was a 3 day event, and thankfully I ate there the first day, so I could go back the other 2.  The food is out of this world, with so many different flavors and ingredients that vegetarians/vegans aren't used to experiencing at a "normal" food establishment.  Food is VERY fresh and unique.  I tried most of the menu, don't ask me to give my favorite because that's an IMPOSSIBLE question that doesn't have an answer.  I have no clue why they don't have a restaurant so we can have access to their food all the time!!  I really wish they would!!

Literally the best food you can eat in Las Vegas, vegan or not. I have tried several items on their menu(and they change it up) and it is all so delicious!! I just wish they had a restaurant that was open everyday!
The best Vegan tacos I have ever tried, and I think they will be the only ones I eat!
The service here is always great. The food is always perfect and I suggest this place to everyone. My only complaint is that I can't go here 7 days a week, lol. My favorite spot ever.

I've eaten at the Garden Grill two times.  Both times I've been shithoused drunk.  There's a man sleeping next to me on a picnic table. That's how drunk I am.  Next to these other drunks, I could run for President.  Anyway.  I have had the Crispy Chick'n Sandwich and the Buffalo Chick'n Sandwich.  Both were delicious and perfectly sauced.  I am in love with them both.  Thank you for listening to me.

Definitely 5 Star all the way. The teriyaki taco is wicked good, and my favorite the beer battered avocado tacos. The beer battered mushrooms are also super good. I really like that they have young coconuts too. Garden Grill is definitely a must have while in Las Vegas

What can I say about Garden Grill?

It's amazing.

I have tried all of her food and I must say her tacos are amazing and they are my fav. Pull up a chair and let me explain...

I think out of the four styles I am in love with the fried avocado one the most! When you bite into the crisp tempura-like thick batter then you reach the creamy avocado center...I just don't think anything else compares. There is really something magical about it.

The breakfast style taco is super good and it reminds me of how hubby makes his morning scramble. Kala Namak salt, turmeric....all the yummys make up that scramble and I love that flavor! 

The famous cheez steak is not my fav...burn me at the stake if you must...I'm just not a fan. I do love the bread but I'm not a fan of faux beef and fajita type grilled onions and peppers. I also like my cheese a more golden silk like cheez lol. Makes zero sense other than the fact I was never a fan preveg so my opinion is invalid.
Just try it for yourself...actually it's huge so ask a friend to help you eat it.

I'm a serious fan of jackfruit pulled BBQ. I try to make it at least once a month because I love me some slaw and baked beans...well pride aside...there is something seriously amazing about her BBQ sauce. It's amazing and she should bottle it. The crunch of the slaw and the tang of the BBQ sauce...YUM!

The tacos are a food item that I crave, no joke I crave them. Heaven help me if she ever goes brick and mortar! 

Be on the lookout for that new Crispy Chick'n Sandwich! Oh and during the colder days the black bean soup in the bread bowl and the amazing albondigas soup...amazing.

Believe it or not, I have never tried her desserts!!!!!! If you try them report back to me because I'm not big sweets fan. Besides...I'm always too full from tacos :) 

Thanks Leslie for all you do for the community!
Don't let the Vegan word scare you. You don't have to be Vegan to eat here. Delicious food, excellent customer service. Someone buy them a location so everyone can eat their food every day!

Amazing street taco place in Tivoli on Saturdays (but make sure you get there early)! When we first went a few months ago, we tried a few different tacos like the jackfruit and the beer battered avocado. They're so scrumptios- perfect for a snack to try their varieties.

After trying the tacos, now we always get a California burrito with the beer battered avocado instead of any "meats" and it's the best thing ever! The avocado cream says and the spicy red sauce that come with it are perfect for dipping and adding a little more flavour. We also always get the hibiscus tea and that is the bomb. Sweet and sour and perfect for hot weather. We go here almost every Saturday just to get this meal and it's always on point and never fails to satisfy.

Plus, the people who work here are so kind and the food comes out quick even with their ever present long lines! Hoping they will have some sort of food truck soon, so we can continue to have more vegan options right here in Summerlin, and have them be more frequent.

Amazing place and it's definitely worth a try!!

Yum! We also just got to taste these selfish tacos at Tivoli today. We had jackfruit tacos with a tasty crema in chewy corn tortillas. Only prob was I wanted bigger ones!! Nice portion of filling, but I would've liked a little more tortilla! My son tried the teriyaki chic ones and loved the protein. He says it is very similar to his favorite plant based protein at Native Foods in LA. Very excited to see you at the farmers market though.

I have not had better vegan tacos than the garden grill! So flavorful and savory without making you feel guilty! The chicken sandwich, quesadillas, and soups are always fresh and delectable. I will follow all the farmers markets in Vegas for Garden Grill's food!
My friend brought me a chicken burger (vegan) and it was the most delicious burger i have ever had!!! Amazing! Cant wait until saturday to go gran another one :)

This place is amazing. I wish they would open a restaurant. I'm not vegan but I look forward to their tent at the farmers market every weekend. 

Must haves: everything but specifically the buffalo chicken sandwich and the jack fruit tacos. So good!

They are on eastern and richmar in Henderson every Sunday. I follow them on instagram to double check bc some weekends they are closed.

The next Saturday morning that you find yourself bored or otherwise without plans, head to Tivoli Village for the Fresh52 farmer's market from 9AM-2PM. I don't care what else you do while there, but make sure you seek out Garden Grill!

Menu is exclusively vegetarian and vegan items, largely composed of Mexican-influenced dishes. Go for the tacos. Specifically the beer-battered avocado (crispy, creamy perfection!) and/or barbecue jackfruit (surprisingly savory!). Try one of each for only $7. If you're really starvin', add a bowl of their pozole!
seriously the best vegan food in las vegas !! I'm a huge fan of the buffalo chicken sandwich. Add some bacon and cheese and your mind will be blown.

Two tacos for $7.00, which can be finished in four bites total, are definitely not worth it.  They were tasty--nothing to write home about, though--but extremely overpriced.  The bottled water was served lukewarm.  I'm not sure I care about how fresh and healthful the ingredients are when I would have to spend $25.00+ just to satisfy my appetite for an on-the-go lunch. How do people get so descriptive about portions that would leave even a three-year old still hungry?

Came here to try their famed avocado tacos. They were definitely tasty but very messy. The corn tortilla got stuck to the plate and fell apart as I was trying to pick it up, it was frustrating to eat after that.

Omg let me tell you how amazing this place is! I absolutely love their concept of fun vegan foods. I personally am not a vegan but I enjoy eating vegan/vegetarian when I can because it's amazing how much flavor they put into these meat/meat product substitutions. I had the jackfruit taco salad and it was super yummz in my tummz. If someone were to feed me this without telling me what it was I definitely would have thought I was eating real meat but it was actually jackfruit! Loved it. I also love how they serve at the farmers market because I believe it keeps their quality strong and reels in customers due to its limited times available. Definitely going to make time again to grab more :)

I got one beer battered avocado taco and one jackfruit taco for $7 and it was more than enough for me and my daughter. Super yummy and fun farmer's market. Really vegan friendly, but this is the place for lunch!

Words cannot explain how delicious Garden Grill truly is. My roommate and I stumbled upon their Instagram and literally waited for their stand to open up at the LVFM today. 

The only downfall to Garden Grill is that everything on the menu looks so good you want to eat it all. 

After carefully deciding, I went with my gut and got the beer battered avocado tacos and California burrito. Newly vegan, I am very questionable on meat alternatives and that burrito got me turnt. 

The "steak" is so tender and tasty and the fries really topped it off. The homemade guacamole brings it all together. 

The avocado tacos were out of this world-- perfect flavor of sweet, tang and spice. 

Will be returning on Sunday to try their breakfast choices. I wish their stand was bed side  so I could just gorge on tasty food all day. 

P.s. The hibiscus tea is the greatest tasting tea... perfect pairing for all of their yummy choices.

Went to the farmers market in eastern today so we could FINALLY get some GG in our lives! The Man & I had avocado taco, jackfruit taco, crispy Chik'n sandwich, and a Cali burrito. AMAZING!! 4 stars only because I still need to try the Thrillest, which wasn't available today. 
Oh! And the service was friendly & fast :)

Incredible food, great people, great prices and convenient. I wish there was a restaurant!! I want more. All the time. It's great to have a full menu with deciduous food and be able to pick anything I want.

I strongly recommend this restaurant. I know Christopher, the owner, and he brings great devotion and love to this work. For he and his family this is not just a business, it is a passion. The food is delicious and there are always many loyal customers there. Do yourself a favor and try this out if you want great vegan food!

I drive to the Eastern and Richmar farmer's market just about every Sunday for this goodness!! Even when I went to LA for a music festival, I hit their booth up. The BEST best best absolutely the best vegan fried chik'n sandwiches you'll ever have! It's so dang crispy and juicy. The breading...omg. Drool. I was a huge fried chicken fan in my non-vegan days and this certainly comes the closest. If you're a fan of Ronald's vegan donuts, try the Thrillest: the bomb vegan fried chik'n, faux bacon, cheese, a zesty mayo, lettuce and tomato served b/w two Ronald's donuts! It may seem pricey, but it's a filler upper fasho. I'm also a fan of the vegan Philly cheesesteak. The bread is so yummy too! It comes with this yummy sauce on top and every bite is so juicy and flavorful. I was a huge fan of the beer battered mushrooms, so I hope these come back! I highly recommend the vegan chik'n sandwich, the Thrillest and the Philly. I'm so excited to go back. They need a cafe already!

BOMB.COM!!! Please try this place out. My first time going and I was hooked I go to the farmers market just for them! I am hooked on their asada tacos and breakfast tacos. I'm working my way through their menu and look forward to trying out their whole menu and new items which they add consistently. Change is good and you'll never get satiated here!!

I'm very disappointed in this company. I flew to Vegas for the weekend and prior to visiting I did an extensive search online and in yelp for vegan food. Found this company with great reviews, so I was super excited and anxious to try the food. Woke up early as Yelp showed only opened on weekends and closed at 2pm as they're at a Farmers market. Called the phone number listed and received recording stating the caller is not taking calls at this time (strange), then decided to show up. Drove about 13 miles from my stay and to my disappointment, this restaurant showing it was open was no where to be seen. Asked other venders and they hadn't seen them in a while. No way of contacting them for info, Ad is not accurate and phone number does not work. Unable to rate the food unfortunately. Hopefully some day!

(It's a tease to post this review just a few days after Garden Grill announces that they are closed until further notice, but that just means you'll have to follow @gardengrilllv on social media and await their big return announcement.)

I don't think that you have to be vegan, vegetarian, fruitarian, or even observing Lent to appreciate Garden Grill. That California burrito could change the mind of even the biggest skeptic. For me, the convenience of enjoying their creative and delicious menu at the farmers market while my daughter runs around on the playground can't be beat, but I'd love to see this hardworking team open their own restaurant!

They make some of the most flavorful vegan food I've ever tried. You might request the sauces on the side if that's your preference, as some dishes tend to be heavy. You can't go wrong with their tacos and the beer-battered avocado is a good choice if you're not a fan of fake meats, but don't be scared of the amazing BBQ jackfruit! The crispy chikn sandwich will make you forget about Chick-Fil-A; get buffalo if you like it spicy. If you want to try a special that they post on special media, arrive early. They will sell out and you will be disappointed. It took me two attempts to score a California burrito. It's huge, packed full of asada, pinto beans, Mexican rice, fries, guacamole and more, and definitely worth $12. They even make a huge bacon burger with doughnut buns using Ronald's doughnuts. What the...

I'll be patiently waiting until they return and I can enjoy my next crispy avocado BLT wrap. Come back soon!
Crispy chicken sandwich was my favorite out of the philly cheese steak,jack taco,avocado taco, and breakfast sandwich!

If you're looking for some really good vegan food, then you've found the right place! A non-vegan friend of mine actually recommended this place to me a long time ago and was raving about their philly cheezesteak, and I'm so glad he did.

For a long time I only got the philly cheezesteak because it was so good and I was too afraid to try everything else. Now that I've tried almost the entire menu, I have a hard time deciding what I want to get because it's all so good! If I had to pick a favorite I'd choose the crispy chick'n sandwich, but the beer-battered avocado tacos come in at a close second. Almost every week they have special items too, and I'd advise getting there early because sometimes they can run out pretty quickly! I could go into detail about specific menu items, but I'm not even going to bother because I've discovered that you really can't go wrong no matter what you order here. Everything is seriously amazing.

As far as price goes, some might say it's a bit pricey, but it's definitely worth the few extra dollars. The food is so flavorful, they use local and organic ingredients when possible, and the people are super friendly. I'm currently transitioning to veganism, and Garden Grill definitely helps satisfy the occasional meat cravings. I've seen their food win over my vegan and non-vegan friends time and time again.

There's a reason why these people are gaining popularity so quickly, and I highly suggest you come find out why for yourself!

I can't get enough of their beer battered avocado tacos, so delicious! Last night I got to the Bruce Trent farmer's market later than usual so they were all sold out of them. Guess I'm not the only one digging on those tacos! So I decided to try the philly cheezesteak. Wow! I was, once again, blown away and my taste buds were thoroughly impressed. 
I was unable to finish the whole thing because it's huge, so I took the rest home and my omni Dad stole and devoured it. Never told him it was vegan, but since he knows I don't eat meat he probably guessed. He wanted to get their location and dates so he could stop by after work and get one for himself. Vegan food is just salads by bottom! 
I don't know what these guys do to make their food so delicious, but they need to keep doing it! I love everything I have tried so far. Next time I will have to venture into their dessert items, but I don't know if I should start down that slippery road... 
If you give the Garden Grill a try you will NOT be disappointed!

I love these guys. What more can you love about deliciously prepared 100% plant-based vegan tacos?!! I love the Jackfruit tacos and cannot wait to try more of their products. Everything is flavorful. The only thing I sort of dislike is that the tacos are $3.50 each and don't quite match up to the size of what you should get. But, i'm not complaining that much because there aren't too many places out here that sell 100% plant-based food. Fantastic food that can fool any carnivore into thinking it's real meat. Fantastic raw desserts as well. I highly recommend!

The Garden Grill in LV is the real deal. We had two types of tacos: fried avocado and jackfruit asada. Both of those were fantastic. Much like a great pizza is enhanced by the crust, a great fried avocado is enhanced by the batter. You can tell that Garden Grill LV pays attention to detail. The batter was excellent in taste and crunch, and the two sauces worked very well together. The jackfruit asada was a little spicy and sour... Just the way I like it. The breakfast burrito was also great. The sausage they use is a little salty, but it's fairly well balanced as a whole... Especially with so much spinach. I guess if I had to change one thing it would be to cut the sausage bits smaller and use less. Finally, the horchata was incredible. Best vegan horchata I've ever had. Not too sweet... Just grainy enough. Perfection with the meal.
I just LOVE Garden Grill! So delicious and fresh. Great service, very friendly!

Growing up as a Mexican-American in Los Angeles, CA there was always an option to go find a taco stand and enjoy some delicious tacos. But as I chose to become Vegan these options seemed far and wide. Unless I cooked at home I couldn't enjoy the street tacos anymore. Now living in Vegas it's been many years since I've enjoyed a street taco, since the Vegan options here are far and wide. 
So you can imagine my utter joy when I found Garden Grill at the farmers market. I ordered 2 of each, Beer-Battered Avocado, BBQ Pulled Jackfruit and Chick'n Teriyaki. As I bit into my first taco, which was the avocado one, I felt these flavors just burst into my mouth and I cried of joy. I honestly could have never  imagined  such flavors bringing me to tears. As I enjoyed the next one, BBQ Pulled Jackfruit I lost it...I was so emotional eating these tacos. It just brought back so many memories of going down to TJ with my family and hitting up all the best taco stands, BUT these were BETTER!  Honestly you have to try these tacos...I will be back for more. One reason being, no GMO's. Support Local Vegan food!
Avocado beer battered tacos. I crave them all the time. Best! I really wish they had a physical address instead of the farmers markets. I would be going there a lot more.
These guys had a tent down at the Fresh 52 farmer's market last weekend, and the tacos are so good.

Found them at First Friday & I'm glad I didn't have to drive too far to find them. I wasn't disappointed, just not as amazed by the food as everyone else.

I had the jackfruit quesadilla, which in my opinion was wayyyyyy overpriced ($10). It wasn't a good portion size, it was an average sized tortilla. They drenched it in 2 sauces, not sure what they were, but it was a lot.  I'm guessing vegan sour cream & a green one, maybe avocado cream? Anyway, the sauces are really rich so I scraped it off. As for the actual quesadilla, it was ok. Didn't blow my mind.

If I run into them again, I will definitely try something else on their menu & ask for sauces on the side!

Today we were at the farmers market for the second time we ordert some food at garden grill. Some tacos. It is soooo good and also glutenfree. I hope they will get more glutenfree options. The only thing what I do not like so much is that it is a little bit too expensive ($7 for two very small tacos and only these two are glutenfree).
Had the fried avocado tacos and they are amazing! I will be back to the farmers market next Sunday for sure!

The tacos are my favorite ! The jackfruit, beer battered avocado, breakfast, etc... You guys have such great flavor (sazon!) and being from Mexico, it totally reminds me of the flavors, but also some amazing things like the Crispy Chicken Sandwich OMG, I think I have liked everything i have tried. And the Agua de Jamaica is perfect, just like in Mexico. 

It's also admirable to see you guys working hard in the horrible Vegas heat and yesterday, as we ate our food in the comfort and warmth of the car, we were watching you guys in the freezing cold working your a**es off! 

Truly amazing contribution to the vegan community - not just vegan, the whole community! Love you guys :D Congrats!

Very awesome vegan food!
They are so freakin tasty, wish they had a restaurant, but sadly they don't. Love all there food I really Wana try the vegan philly

I honestly have never been as amazed as I was with my experience with Garden Grill. WOW.

I took my entire family to the Farmers Market and we all ate different dishes at Garden Grill, and keep in mind half of my family are not vegans. Anyway, they were SHOCKED and wanted more because it was so delicious.

1. Food- 10/10
I cannot say enough about the food, everything was perfectly flavored! The crispy chicken sandwiches were PERFECT...seriously so crunchy and so tasty. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. The tacos were AMAZING with the delicious sauce they put on it- was just so so so so good. My favorite was the buffalo chicken sandwich- tasted like crunchy hot wings in a bun. I'm seriously going to be here every weekend. Amazing. 

2. Service- 10/10
The guy helping us was so nice, and so friendly- he has the best customer service and even helped take some overload of food to a nearby table. He asked to make sure that everything was great, which it was. Also the food was done within 15 minutes and we ordered 6 different things from the menu. Great service. 

3. Price- 10/10
Nothing was crazy expensive, and for the quality I feel like it should have cost more! But please don't do that! haha 


Everyone seriously needs to try this place out, even if you aren't vegan...TRUST ME when I say you wont be able to tell the difference. It was just so incredibly great. I really wish they opened a restaurant because I would be there every day ahha 

Perfect. Amazing. Delicious.

This review is fro 4.5 stars.

I'm always skeptical when a restaurant has 5 stars with over 50 reviews, but I came to Garden Grill with an open mind.  And man, this place is very good.  Plant-based ingredients, terrific dishes, and surprisingly large portions.  The meal had a hangover cure feel to it as the sandwiches were full of heavy ingredients and sauce and bread, but still terrific.  The California Burrito ($12) was the size of a large Chipotle, full of beans, pico de gallo, guacamole, plant-based steak, cheese, and french fries.  I could have done without the french fries and cheese but the rest of the ingredients were fresh and delicious.  The hot sauce was awesome as well; don't forget to get extra.  The buffalo chicken sandwich ($10) had  a little too much sauce, but the meat itself was so flavorful that I'll give the sauce overload a pass. Add the great coleslaw on the sandwich and we have a winner. 

The prices are of a sit down brunch spot overall but the portions are big and service was great and quick. The bread greatly underperformed in my opinion on the sandwich as well as the tortilla for the burrito, which is the main reason I'm knocking Garden Grill down from a 5 star experience.  I do really like that they park specifically at Farmer's Market which show the spot's freshness.  I would come here often if they opened a storefront.  Here's to hoping.

As someone just starting to go off red meat it's awesome to find delicious vegan/vegetarian food. The avocado tacos are better than I expected. I totally get why there stand is busy and worth the ten minute wait. Def want to try the buffalo chicken sandwich next time!
Finally had Garden Grill at the Grow Your Own Festival today!  My hunny and I shared the buffalo chick'n sandwich.  It was so good we we're almost fighting over it! LOL

Went to the farmers market last weekend to try garden grill and came back this week because it was that good!  Zari took care of us and she gave the best recommendations!  Today I got the philly cheesesteak which was AMAZING and my fiance got the breakfast burrito which was gone in two seconds.  Love garden grill! Xoxo
Amazing food..........you wont be sorry to stop by... .......5 stars for sure...........Bit far from my house but definitely worth ........ Fair price.......

Tried the jack fruit and beer battered avocado tacos at first Friday. They were both so delicious!  I'm a vegetarian slowly making my way into the vegan lifestyle. Inspired to make the leap after trying their amazing food.

I ate the Caesar's Envy Wrap and it was AMAZING!! It was large and tasty! I found them at First Friday and they're at the Fresh52 Farmer's Markets on Saturdays and Sundays. Customer service was excellent as well. I watched them make the California burrito and I am determined to try that one, it looked epic!

They also have fried avocado tacos.... so many tasty options to choose from!
Everything is delicious!!!! You cannot go wrong with anything you pick here. Meat eaters and vegans can all agree this is some of the best vegan dining in the nation!!!!

These guys deserve 20 stars!! I wish I could give them all a raise! Haha they really are amazing.

I'm ashamed of myself for not having written a review sooner but I am glad that I have been able to enjoy their food a few times before I can give them a solid A+ rating.

Their "chicken" sandwich is the best sandwich I have had since becoming a vegetarian, 8 years ago. The breading might as well be real chicken skin (and I know that might be weird for some vegetarian/vegans, but I LOVE IT!!) I miss chicken the most, of all of the meat, and their sandwich has a huge portion of it, along with tomato, romaine, and a sauce like an aoli all on a toasted bun. It's filling as hell and is like vegan comfort food. 

I've gotten the deep-fried battered avocado taco as well as the carne asada, I think... The avocado was AMAZING and is by-far the most ordered meal from them. I mean, who doesn't love a beer-battered avocado deep fried and topped with some delicious sauces?? Heaven!! 

Ooh! Almost forgot to mention that their horchata is perfect!  it tastes like cinnamon toast crunch. Their jamaica (hibiscus tea) is rich and flavorful and I've heard it's the best you can get in the valley. Justtttt make sure to keep the lid on because that stuff will stain! A gorgeous purple color, but still a stain. :P

These men and women work SO hard to make some of the best food in the valley for damn good prices. I got to see some of the passion that they put into their cooking and service first hand and they WOW me. I wish I could tell everyone about the Garden Grill. :)

I absolutely love this place - I wish they had a permanent location! They had lines every single time I walked by their tent at Life Is Beautiful Festival both years I've been, and every time they're at a farmers market. I was so impressed and happy for them. I've had their Beer Battered Avocado tacos, their Carne tacos, California burrito, Philly Cheeze Steak sandwich, Caesar's revenge wrap, and cheesecake, and I can honestly say that they were all very well done.
Either these people are liars, or I consumed the best vegan chicken known to man! Wow, this place is great!!! Get the crispy chicken sandwich!!! You will not be disappointed :)
At FYF in Los Angeles and my favorite vendor from Vegas is here fuck yeah! The Thrillest!! I'm so glad to see my local heros making it at this concert!!

Garden Grill is amazing! The food & staff is the best. Cute, family owned farmers market stand with very creative and delicious dishes to try. The waffles were so yummy and tasted like churros! The pozole reminds me of home cooked pozole that I would eat prior to becoming vegan. Everything is great and everything on the menu needs to be tasted at least once!

Loooooove Garden Grill.  Just know this: the food is superb.  Delicious.  So flavorful.  Truly great vegan food.  The ONLY - and I mean the only - downside is that I can't get this as often as I want because it is slightly on the expensive side.  Everything I've tried was amazing, though!

During our Vegas trip, we planned on grabbing a bite to eat before heading to the Hoover Dam.  I looked on the map and the original place we wanted to try was in the opposite direction of the dam.  So we decided to scratch that plan and see what was up with the Las Vegas Farmer's Market.  I searched for Farmer's Markets on Yelp and found Fresh52 located on Sundays at Sansone Park Place which was in the direction of the Hoover Dam. It was the perfect pit stop to the dam!

As we were walking through the Farmer's Market we found Garden Grill - an all vegan food stand specializing in tacos!  I was a happy girl as I stared at their mouthwatering display of tacos with creative fillings such as  - beer battered avocado, BBQ pulled jackfruit, chick'n teriyaki, asada jackfruit, breakfast, and plant-based steak.  Everything looked so delicious!  Not only did they have tacos, but they were also serving up philly cheeze steak sandwiches and specials like chick'n and waffles.  

My BF and I ordered two tacos each (2 beer battered avocado, BBQ jackfruit, and breakfast) and split the chick'n and waffles.  We were both in heaven as we ate our tacos - they were all so good!  I was happy that our chick'n and waffles also came WITH mashed potatoes and mushroom gravy; I don't see that too often with my experience with vegan chick'n and waffles in the Bay.  The chick'n was perfectly crunchy, waffle was perfectly crispy and mash and gravy was savory and delicious.  We were fighting for the last bite of waffle.  LOL.

We absolutely loved Garden Grill and hope they will expand and come to the Bay Area.  I also appreciated that their menu said "Compassionate Food Crafters" and "Vegan for Life".  Thank you Garden Grill for making the world a better place!

well...I was very hesitant to try but my bf has been looking for vegan "real food". We tried the Chik'n & Fried Avocado tacos and the Philly Cheesesteak. I took a bite of his Teriyaki Chic'n and it was ok. Im not sure if knowing it wasn't chicken made me not like it as much but it wasn't bad but nothing I need to go get. The Philly was pretty tasty. I will say the tacos were pretty small but the Philly was a nice size. The pics I saw seemed like they were huge. He enjoyed both but said it definitely wasn't meat.

Yum yum and more yum! Still cannot get over the pulled jackfruit! Unbelievably flavorful! My friend Sue told me about this place and it great! Vegans and non vegans alike will love this place. They truly have mastered the art of making vegan foods taste amazing and not like rubber or cardboard haha! Super nice people to. I am not able to make it to the farmers markets often but caught this guys at the Wendsday Bruce Trent market at I was so happy I tried them. It really WAS very good!

I used to frequent Garden Grill when they were at Bruce Trent's Farmers Market on Wednesdays. Now, they are at the Fresh52 Farmers Market inside Tivoli Village every Saturday. The food has always been delicious. This past Saturday, I got the Buffalo Crispy Chick'n sandwich as well as the breakfast burrito and tacos, which they didn't have when they were at Bruce Trent's but great additions to the menu nonetheless. If you're a vegan in Las Vegas, this place is a must!

Every time someone asks me what I'm craving to eat, garden grill is the first to come to mind. It's kind of a problem since they're only at farmers markets. Everything on their menu is phenomenal! It's all plant based, but their substitute meats and faux dairies actually taste better than the real deal. I've had friends that tried their food, not even being able to tell that it was all vegan until I told them. They need a permanent spot because I'd be all up in that!
OMG the vegan chick'n burger is sooooo good. I have dreams about it. Honestly, I don't even try anything else because that's all I ever want.
Best vegan food hands down! Quick service, food is always hot, employees are always nice. They just need a permanent restaurant !!

Oh man these street tacos were amazing. 
And I wasn't even in Los Angeles.  
The reviews do them justice.  We were at the farmers market and I felt bad for any other food cart that set up next to them.
Great people working this and amazing food! Had the teriyaki and the avocado, 5 out of 6 prefer the avocado!
Tried Garden Grill our at the Grown Your Own Festival. I had the beer avocado tacos and the spicy chicken sandwich. Both were delicious but I do think the tacos are pretty pricey.

We bumped into this place at Tivoli village farmers market and were blown away first - by their service, then by the food! Their new crispy chicken sandwich was amazing. Better than real chicken! So fresh and good. Can't wait for them to open up all over Vegas!
Incredible food. I've gone out of my way to where they are in town. I take all my out of town friends here to blow their minds with bomb vegan food. SO GOOD!!!

The best Vegan Restaurant I have ever been to.  Last time I was here, I ordered a deep fried avocado taco and a pulled jack fruit taco.  Both were tasty.  I also ordered deep fried mushrooms and they were excellent as well.  I would recommend you stop by and at least try something from this place.

Omg how have I not reviewed this place?! I go here all the time... And it's amazing. I burnt myself out on the tacos (they are all good), my favorite item is the California burrito (with 'carne' and it's amazing). Leslie and Chris are so nice and all the food I've had is to perfection! It's a great place for veg and non veg people. Even if you're a meat lover... The BBQ jackfruit tacos will make you think again. I also love the Caesar wrap in the summer - it's a really refreshing meal. If you are craving something sweet get the raw cheesecake. You won't regret it.
Delicious vegan food!  Love the quesadillas and street tacos, especially the chicken and jackfruit!  The cheesecake is delicious as well!  Friendly and helpful people :)

Omg! was this vegan food stand worth the wait!!! 20 min turned to over 40 but it was worth the blazing sun frying my head lol! I honestly could not believe that the buffalo chicken burger was actually vegan! It looks and tastes like real chicken, I will definetly  be stopping by here once a week! Give it a try everyone :)

Fate brought me to Garden Grill.

We had plans to be in Vegas for the weekend. Because we were gonna be in town, I entered to win tickets to the Life Is Beautiful music festival. Then I won two 3-day VIP passes thanks to Yelp LA West CM Brittany F.! Immediately did my research and discovered that Garden Grill was going to be serving up some vegan goodies at the festival.

Sh*t just got real!

At this point, I didn't even care about the bands anymore (except for Fitz and the Tantrums). All I could think about was BBQ Pulled Jackfruit Tacos and Beer Battered Avocado Tacos.

The line was surprisingly long. I didn't realize vegan food would be so popular at a music festival. But I guess that's a good thing. Each taco was offered at two for $8 but sadly they wouldn't let you mix and match that day. Later on I discovered that there's a Yelp check-in offer for $1 off your first order that I wish I knew about before hand. I also noticed that the taco prices listed on their website is $1 less than what they offered it for at the festival. Damn those festival prices!

Great BBQ flavor in the Jackfruit Tacos and I liked the crunchy mix of shredded cabbage in there. The creamy dill sauce on top was tasty too. http://bit.ly/1E7np5J

The portion was much smaller than I would have liked it to be for $8. Let's just say, on the drive back to LA, I stopped by a vegan market/cafe (Viva La Vegan in Rancho Cucamonga) and their jackfruit tacos were a much bigger and filling size at $3 a taco.

I was still hungry after eating Garden Grill's jackfruit tacos so I ended up ordering the Beer Battered Avocado Tacos in which the serving size was significantly bigger. Large chunks of avocado batter fried in a way that doesn't make the avocado taste cooked (which I prefer). More crunchy shredded cabbage and a delicious creamy cilantro pepita dressing and Sriracha. It's very messy to eat but yum yum yum yum YUM! http://bit.ly/1yKXca0

The meateater BF was curious about the menu too so he ordered a Chick'n Ceasar Salad Wrap with grilled chick'n, ceasar dressing, croutons and romaine lettuce wrapped in a yummy spinach tortilla. I thought it was tasty! The meateater BF said he liked it better than the meaty prime beef sandwich from T-bones Chophouse a few tents down from Garden Grill. Yay for hooking the meateater! http://bit.ly/10DEeac

Yeah it's kinda pricey but the sad truth is, I would pay that much for their deliciousness. They get 5-stars from me! I just wish I had room for the Raw Chocolate Cheezecake while we were there.
The best vegan fast food I have ever had ever!!  the buffalo chicken sandwich is my favorite!

Garden Grill is the main reason I make the trip to our farmers markets. So far I have only tried their tacos. If im speaking from a mexican food point of view their flavors are delicous and authentic, if im speaking from a vegan point of view its the same thing! Im not a vegan but I still love it when a restaurant can take something so familiar like tacos and make it completly vegan and still have that same comfort food experience. Plus where else would I be able to try Jackfruit? So far I havn't seen it on any other menus around town. 
There tacos are usually 2 for $7 so on my last visit I ordered the bbq jackfruit and the beet battered avocado tacos. Both were very tasty. I loved that the avocado taco came with a very beautiful and generous slice of a nice ripe and creamy quality avocado. And I'm not sure if they make there own tortillas or not but they are soft and delicious!
the only critiscm I can offer is that they sauces or salsa's could be a little spicier in my opnion. But other than that what ever Garden Grill is doing I hope they keep on doing it!

Just died and went to heaven! 
Drove to the farmers market in Vegas (coming from Denver) and had to check this place out. My girlfriend and I each ordered a breakfast, jackfruit, and battered avocado taco with an agua fresca jamaica. Let me just say... WOW! The tea was extremely delicious and refreshing and complimented the meal nicely. Each of the tacos were savory and perfectly balanced between texture, spice and sweetness. Though I enjoyed all of the tacos, my favorite was the jackfruit! While trying to convince me of buying her a second jackfruit taco, my girlfriend said "If I can relive the best moment of my life for $3.50, I'll do it!" 

I highly recommend checking this place out no matter your dietary preferences or needs.

Best Tacos in Vegas !! Or anywhere else !! 

We've tried them all & my wife had and absolutely LOVED the Chik'n Sammich. Another weekend we tried the Vegan Pozole which since we are now vegan we don't ever get to have unless we make it. So tasty good !! The cabbage, lemon & onions complimented it perfectly. Memories of our childhoods came rushing back. You don't realize the power food has to elicit emotion until you taste something this good. 

Everything we have tried from the Philly Cheez Steak to the yummy desserts have been top shelf perfect. Amazing culinary talent here & really super nice family people. 

Also, some people gave less than stellar reviews based mostly on price. I've been coming to Fresh 52 for years now & now know some of the other vendors. NO ONE IS GETTING RICH AT THE FARMER'S MARKET !! They use such high quality ingredients & have to work so hard to bring you this food that they love so much that some weeks they don't even make $$. They count on the busy times to make up for the slow times where they actually lose $$. They have no backers & do this all on their own. 

So everyone come support something so unique & delicious in Las Vegas !!!

My favorite vendor to go to whenever they're at Tivoli Village's Fresh 52 Farmer's Market!

This I've tried:

Beer-battered avocado tacos: the sauce reaaaally makes the taco for me (and of course, the avocados)

Chicken sandwich: their "chicken" patty tastes so much better than real chicken patties in my opinion. The sauce they use in this sandwich is really good too and I love that they have avocados in there as well.

The Thrillist: basically the chicken sandwich but with donut (yes, DONUT) buns and soy bacon strips. I felt really adventurous that day, but honestly I like the regular chicken sandwich a lot more.

BBQ pulled jackfruit tacos: very tangy, not my favorite since it was too BBQ-ey, but still very tasty.

Beer-battered mushrooms with a side of aioli sauce: my favorite side dish! The mushrooms were MASSIVE & very juicy. Once again, the sauce really made this one for me too.
Amazing vegan food.  Crispy chicken sandwich is my favorite!  Have tried many different tacos, yet to be anything but thrilled.  Quick for what it is and definitely hits the spot every time.
